value.verse: He who dwells in the shelter of the Most High, *
value.halfverse: abides under the shadow of the Almighty.

value.verse:
He shall say to the LORD,
“You are my refuge and my stronghold, *
value.halfverse: my God in whom I put my trust.”

value.verse: He shall deliver you from the snare of the hunter *

He shall cover you with his pinions,
and you shall find refuge under his wings; *
value.halfverse: his faithfulness shall be a shield and buckler.

value.verse: You shall not be afraid of any terror by night, *
value.halfverse: nor of the arrow that flies by day;
nor of the sickness that lays waste at mid-day.
value.verse: Of the plague that stalks in the darkness, *

value.halfverse: but it shall not come near you.
value.verse:
A thousand shall fall at your side
and ten thousand at your right hand, *
Your eyes have only to behold *
value.halfverse: to see the reward of the wicked.
and the Most High your habitation,
value.verse: Because you have made the LORD your refuge, *

value.halfverse: neither shall any plague come near your dwelling.
value.verse: There shall no evil happen to you, *

value.halfverse: to keep you in all your ways.
value.verse: For he shall give his angels charge over you, *

value.halfverse: lest you dash your foot against a stone.
value.verse: They shall bear you in their hands, *

value.halfverse: you shall trample the young lion and the serpent under your feet.
value.verse: You shall tread upon the lion and the adder; *

value.halfverse: I will protect him, because he knows my Name.
value.verse:
Because he is bound to me in love,
therefore will I deliver him; *

value.halfverse:
I am with him in trouble;
 I will rescue him and bring him to honor.
value.verse: He shall call upon me, and I will answer him; *
With long life will I satisfy him, *
